intro: Prenanthes alata, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, which is surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Prenanthes alata typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
